revised_title: Optimal Resource Management and Population Extinction
tldr: The article discusses the optimal exploitation of populations in three stochastic models that allow demographic and environmental variability and the possibility of extinction. The authors find that the optimal threshold for harvesting differs depending on whether one maximizes the total return before extinction or the rate of return per unit time. They also emphasize the importance of considering extinction and restart times in resource management.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Population Ecology
